intro: Hemionitis rouxii, commonly known as the sandmat, is a rare and unique succulent native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Hemionitidaceae and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant features small, fleshy leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white, powdery bloom, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It produces delicate, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue, blooming in late spring or early summer. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Hemionitis rouxii is considered a vulnerable species.
